org.microtitan.diffusive.launcher

Class DiffusiveLauncher

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.microtitan.diffusive.launcher.DiffusiveLauncher

  • public class DiffusiveLauncher
extends java.lang.Object
    Launches the user application in a way that all method calls to methods annotated with @Diffusive are intercepted and passed off to a Diffuser which runs the code and returns the results. Although execution of the method may take place on a different machine, JVM, or locally, the code works as if the diffusion where turned off. The main method allows users to run this as an application, handing the name of the class for which execute the main(...) method, and handing it a list of command line arguments that main(...) method accepts. In this way, there is no change to the code that is run, with the exception of the @Diffusive annotations that are added to the methods that are to be diffused.
    Author:
    Robert Philipp

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private static class  DiffusiveLauncher.RunMode
      Whether the diffuser launcher is to diffuse to remote diffusers or just stay local for debugging.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DiffusiveLauncher

        public DiffusiveLauncher(DiffusiveLoader loader)
        Constructs a DiffusiveLauncher using the specified class loader.
        Parameters:
        loader - The DiffusiveLoader used to load classes, rewrite diffusive methods, and delegate loading to the parent class loader.

      • DiffusiveLauncher

        public DiffusiveLauncher(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object[]> configurationClasses,
                 java.util.List<java.lang.String> classPaths)
        Constructs a DiffusiveLauncher that uses a default DiffusiveLoader to load classes, rewrite diffusive methods, and delegate loading to the parent class loader. Uses a RestfulDiffuser, uses the default values from the DiffusiveLoader to determine which classes to load using the parent class loader (logging, abdera, diffusive configuration annotation, etc).
        Parameters:
        configurationClasses - the classes holding the configuration for the launcher. Associated with each configuration class is an {@link Object}[] containing any arguments the configuration method may need.

      • DiffusiveLauncher

        public DiffusiveLauncher()
        Constructs a DiffusiveLauncher that uses a default DiffusiveLoader to load classes, rewrite diffusive methods, and delegate loading to the parent class loader. Uses a RestfulDiffuser, uses the default values from the DiffusiveLoader to determine which classes to load using the parent class loader (logging, abdera, diffusive configuration annotation, etc).

      • createLoader

        public static final DiffusiveLoader createLoader(java.util.List<java.lang.String> classPaths)
        Parameters:
        classPaths - The class paths to the application's jar file
        Returns:
        a DiffusiveLoader that uses the default set of configuration class, the default set of delegation prefixes (defined in the DiffusiveLoader class), and the default DiffusiveTranslator.

      • createLoader

        public static final DiffusiveLoader createLoader(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object[]> configurations)
        Creates a DiffusiveLoader the uses the specified list of configuration classes, the default set of delegation prefixes (defined in the DiffusiveLoader class), and the default DiffusiveTranslator.
        Parameters:
        configurations - A List containing the names of configuration classes that are used for configuration. Because these need to be loaded by this class loader, they must all be static methods (i.e. the class shouldn't have already been loaded) and they must be annotated with the @DiffusiveConfiguration annotation. Associated with each configuration class is an {@link Object}[] containing any arguments the configuration method may need.
        Returns:
        a DiffusiveLoader

      • createLoader

        public static final DiffusiveLoader createLoader(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object[]> configurations,
                           java.util.List<java.lang.String> classPaths)
        Creates a DiffusiveLoader the uses the specified list of configuration classes, the default set of delegation prefixes (defined in the DiffusiveLoader class), and the default DiffusiveTranslator.
        Parameters:
        configurations - A List containing the names of configuration classes that are used for configuration. Because these need to be loaded by this class loader, they must all be static methods (i.e. the class shouldn't have already been loaded) and they must be annotated with the @DiffusiveConfiguration annotation. Associated with each configuration class is an {@link Object}[] containing any arguments the configuration method may need.
        classPaths - The class paths to the application's jar file
        Returns:
        a DiffusiveLoader

      • createLoader

        public static final DiffusiveLoader createLoader(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object[]> configurations,
                           java.util.List<java.lang.String> classPaths,
                           DiffusiveTranslator translator)
        Creates a DiffusiveLoader the uses the specified list of configuration classes, the default set of delegation prefixes (defined in the DiffusiveLoader class), and the specified DiffusiveTranslator.
        Parameters:
        configurations - A List containing the names of configuration classes that are used for configuration. Because these need to be loaded by this class loader, they must all be static methods (i.e. the class shouldn't have already been loaded) and they must be annotated with the @DiffusiveConfiguration annotation. Associated with each configuration class is an {@link Object}[] containing any arguments the configuration method may need.
        classPaths - The class paths to the application's jar file
        translator - The translator used to modify the diffusive methods.
        Returns:
        a DiffusiveLoader

      • createLoader

        public static final DiffusiveLoader createLoader(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object[]> configurations,
                           java.util.List<java.lang.String> classPaths,
                           java.util.List<java.lang.String> delegationPrefixes,
                           DiffusiveTranslator translator)
        Creates a DiffusiveLoader the uses the specified list of configuration classes, the specified set of delegation prefixes (defined in the DiffusiveLoader class), and the specified DiffusiveTranslator.
        Parameters:
        configurations - A List containing the names of configuration classes that are used for configuration. Because these need to be loaded by this class loader, they must all be static methods (i.e. the class shouldn't have already been loaded) and they must be annotated with the @DiffusiveConfiguration annotation. Associated with each configuration class is an {@link Object}[] containing any arguments the configuration method may need.
        classPaths - The class paths to the application's jar file
        delegationPrefixes - The list of prefixes to the fully qualified class name. Classes whose fully qualified class names start with one of these prefixes are loaded by the parent class loader instead of this one.
        translator - The translator used to modify the diffusive methods.
        Returns:
        a DiffusiveLoader

      • runClean

        public static void runClean(java.lang.String classNameToRun,
            java.lang.String... programArguments)
        Runs the application without using Javassist to instrument the code for diffusion. This simply allows you to test you application through the system class loader. Mainly available for debugging.
        Parameters:
        classNameToRun - The name of the class for which to run it "main" method
        programArguments - The command-line arguments passed to the "main" method

      • validateRunMode

        private static final DiffusiveLauncher.RunMode validateRunMode(joptsimple.OptionSpec<java.lang.String> runModeSpec,
                                        joptsimple.OptionSet options)
        Validates the the user specified a valid run mode. If the user specified a valid run-mode string, then the method returns the associated run mode, otherwise it exits with a message.
        Parameters:
        runModeSpec - The command-line specification for the run-mode
        options - The options entered on the command-line by the user
        Returns:
        The DiffusiveLauncher.RunMode associated with the user-specified string.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Make sure to run a RestfulDiffuserServer instance before calling this. And make sure that the endpoint listed in the RestfulDiffuserServer.DEFAULT_SERVER_URI method matches up to that in the RestfulDiffuserConfig so that it knows how to call the endpoint.
        Parameters:
        args -
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
